name: Introduction to Cultural Anthropology
description: This course provides an overview of the sub-field of anthropology that focuses on the study of culture, including its emergence, transmission, evolution, and diversity.

name: Linguistic Anthropology
description: This course introduces the study of human language and communication from an anthropological perspective. Topics include language structure, origin and evolution, and sociolinguistic practices.

name: Ethnography of Culture
description: This course explores anthropological methods of ethnography, including fieldwork techniques, field notes, interviewing, participant observation, and research design.

name: Anthropology of Religion
description: This course examines the religious beliefs, practices, and cultural contexts of various societies from an anthropological perspective.

name: Theory and Methods in Cultural Anthropology
description: This course explores the theoretical and methodological foundations of cultural anthropology, including evolutionary, ecological, Marxist, symbolic, and post-modern approaches.
